title: Geordie Shore’s Marnie Simpson welcomes a ‘beautiful baby boy’
text:
Marnie Simpson has welcomed a baby boy

Marnie Simpson has welcomed a ‘beautiful baby boy’, 12 days after her due date.

The Geordie Shore star and her boyfriend Casey, 24, confirmed the news in a statement via her reps.

‘Marnie gave birth to a beautiful baby boy yesterday afternoon. Mother and son are both doing well,’ it read.

Marnie, 27, is one of the Geordie Shore OGs and she has been proudly sharing beautiful pictures of her bump throughout her pregnancy.

She previously revealed she was a week over her due date, and that she had booked in her induction.

Keen to record every precious moment, the 27-year-old shared a naked picture showing off her baby bump in late August and all we had to say is – Demi Moore, eat your heart out.

Marnie was nearly two weeks over his due date, and she told her fans she was ‘suffering’ earlier this week.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘So blessed to have this human in my life. I’ve suffered so badly the last week as I’m now ten days over due and I have to admit it’s tough,’ she captioned a picture of her bump.

‘Words can’t explain the discomfort, but generally wouldn’t be able to get through it without you. Love you so much. I’m so lucky to have you by my side.’

Marnie and Casey are having a boy (Picture: Getty Images)

While Marnie oozed confidence in the nude picture, the Geordie girl has admitted she has struggled with gaining stretch marks and cellulite during her pregnancy.

She wrote on Instagram earlier this month: ‘Can’t believe I’m almost there, pregnancy has been a experience (sic).

‘Watching my body change has been challenging to say the least not going to lie, I’ve started to develop some stretch marks and water retention leaving me with a hell more cellulite than usual, which is daunting but I know it’s going to be so worth it regardless when I see my baby Boy, no pregnancy is perfect, I’ve felt insecure, tired, hormonal and over all crap, social media only sees the ups never the downs! (sic).

‘Which is frustrating but I wanna keep it real for all the other mammas out there!!!’

Advertisement

Advertisement

She added: ‘I’m also suffering with major anxiety daily about the birth and the aftermath, especially with all my previous bladder trouble I’m just so scared of the unknown, I’m so grateful for all the messages I get daily it literally keeps me going and calms me down to know there is so many of us all feeling the same.

‘We got this girlies.’
